programme.title: Kalnieši. Dzīve augstienē 7
programme.desc: Trīs vīri – Jūstass, Toms un Mārtijs – dzīvo vienkāršu dzīvi kalnos. Tomēr neļaujiet vārdam “vienkāršs” sevi apmuļķot! Šo vīru mitekļos nav nekādu mūsdienu ērtību, viņi pavada dienas Amerikas nelīdzenajos kalnos, cīnoties ar izsalkušiem savvaļas zvēriem, dubļu nogruvumiem, vētrām un krītošiem kokiem, lai sagādātu sev visu, kas nepieciešams izdzīvošanai.

programme.title: Džeisons Borns
programme.desc: Bijusī CIP slepenā aģente Nikija Pārsone (Džūlija Stailza) reiz palīdzēja Bornam (Mets Deimons), pēc tam nozuda un šobrīd strādā kopā ar ziņotāju, kurš gatavojas nodot atklātībā CIP slepenās specoperācijas. Nikija ielaužas CIP sistēmā un lejupielādē visu, kas saistīts ar specoperācijām, tostarp operāciju „Dzirnakmens”, kurā piedalījās Borns. CIP aģente Hetera Lī (Alīsija Vikandere) atklāj ielaušanos un par to ziņo CIP direktoram Robertam Dūvijam (Tomijs Lī Džonss), kurš ir specoperāciju galvenais vadītājs.

programme.title: Lūzuma punkts (1991)
programme.desc: Jaunais FIB aģents Džonijs Jūta izmeklē banku aplaupīšanas lietu. FIB uzskata, ka par ASV prezidentiem pārģērbušies bandas locekļi varētu būt sērfotāji. Džonija pārinieks pārliecina viņu slepus iefiltrēties sērfotāju aprindās, lai ievāktu informāciju. Jūta iepazīstas ar bandas vadoni – sērfotāju Bodī, kura harisma un enerģija drīz savaldzina jauniņo FIB aģentu, tāpat kā Bodī bijusī draudzene Tailere...

programme.title: Gāzi grīdā: Polārizlaidums. TOP GEAR: POLAR SP (2007) YR 9 Ep. 7
programme.desc: Kā vislabāk nokļūt Ziemeļpolā? Slavenā britu trijotne dodas vienā no riskantākajiem piedzīvojumiem raidījuma vēsturē, lai to noskaidrotu sīvās sacensībās – mašīna pret haskiju vilktām ragavām. Kamēr Hamonds veic 640 kilometrus ar suņu pajūgu, Klārksons un Mejs dodas ceļā ar uzlabotu "Toyota Hilux". Tomēr Hamonds aukstumā drīz sasniedz savas fiziskās un psiholoģiskās robežas. Un arī Klārksons ar Meju met jokus pie malas, kad abi iestrēgst milzīgā ledāju laukā.

programme.title: Gāzi grīdā: Botsvānas speciālizlaidums. TOP GEAR: BOTSWANA SP (2007) YR 10 Ep. 4
programme.desc: Ar pilnpiedziņas auto un biezu maku pasauli var apceļot jebkurš. Džeremijs Klārksons, Ričards Hamonds un Džeimss Mejs nolēmuši pierādīt, ka īsti profesionāļi var tikt galā ar ierobežotiem līdzekļiem pat ekstremālos apstākļos. Trim piedzīvojumu meklētājiem ir jāveic vairāk nekā 1600 kilometru gara distance ar paša izraudzītu transportlīdzekli. Trijotnes ceļojuma maršrutā ietilpst arīdzan viens no lielākajiem sāls tuksnešiem pasaulē un slavenā Okavango delta.

programme.title: Sporta notikumu tops
programme.desc: Iespaidīgi stāsti par nozīmīgākajiem mirkļiem un personībām sportā. Desmit neaizmirstamākās debijas, desmit vērtīgākie pionieri sportā, visu laiku lieliskākās atgriešanās un citi aizraujoši notikumi, kas atstājuši nospiedumu pasaules sporta vēstures lappusēs.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.sub-title: The Khmer empire had been one of the most powerful states in Southeast Asia, but its strengths soon came to be fatal weaknesses contributing to the fall of its magnificent temple cities.
programme.desc: Why do civilisations collapse? Follow archaeologists as they examine ruins across the world and uncover the reasons why some of historys greatest civilisations vanished.

programme.title: A Justice of Terror
programme.desc: We reveal how laws were used by the Nazis to justify the unjustifiable and authorise the most heinous of crimes, and we also learn what role jurists played in this reinterpretation of law.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler: Decoding A Dictator
programme.sub-title: Architecture mattered a great deal to Adolf Hitler; his grandiose visions were not merely buildings, but symbols of a tyrannical vision intended to impose a sense of domination upon the the world.
programme.desc: This series explores six distinctive aspects of the life and rule of Adolf Hitler and questions how a 30-year-old uneducated nobody was able to leave a legacy of unprecedented evil.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: A true story in which we see how the Berlin murder squad came up against the Nazi regimes ideologies, hindering the investigation and letting a serial killer slip through their fingers.
programme.desc: A look at some of the most shocking Nazi murder cases. Incorporating expert interviews and dramatic reconstruction, each episode tells another side to a time in history that you thought you knew.

programme.title: Who Wrote the Bible?
programme.desc: In an exciting archaeological and scientific investigation, we meet the most eminent specialists in the Bible to try to answer one fundamental question: who wrote the Holy Book?

programme.title: Genghis Khans Mongolia
programme.sub-title: The legend of the Mongols in popular imagination of being bloodthirsty marauders has been obliterated by a more nuanced reality of Mongol life where people were rewarded for talent and not status.
programme.desc: We explore the evolution of the Mongol Empire, from its humble beginnings to becoming an extraordinary force; they conquered vast territories and came to be four times larger than the Roman Empire.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: We discover an intriguing new theory about Gobekli Tepe in southern Turkey; one of the worlds oldest mysteries dating back over 12,000 years, we still dont understand who built it or why.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The Habsburgs were the most powerful family in Europe for centuries; why was their destiny so fatal, and were all their tribulations connected to some kind of curse?
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: We discover an intriguing new theory about Gobekli Tepe in southern Turkey; one of the worlds oldest mysteries dating back over 12,000 years, we still dont understand who built it or why.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler: Decoding A Dictator
programme.sub-title: Architecture mattered a great deal to Adolf Hitler; his grandiose visions were not merely buildings, but symbols of a tyrannical vision intended to impose a sense of domination upon the the world.
programme.desc: This series explores six distinctive aspects of the life and rule of Adolf Hitler and questions how a 30-year-old uneducated nobody was able to leave a legacy of unprecedented evil.

programme.title: The Fascists and the Freemasons
programme.desc: Nazism and fascism shared a hatred for the Freemasons, the most powerful society of their times; we investigate the reasons for fascisms obsession with Freemasonry and uncover its consequences.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: This is the dark tale of the skeleton of an unknown woman found in a hollowed-out tree in a Birmingham woodland. We discover that both the remains and police files have vanished from the archives.
programme.desc: A look at some of the most shocking Nazi murder cases. Incorporating expert interviews and dramatic reconstruction, each episode tells another side to a time in history that you thought you knew.

programme.title: The Pharaohs: Greater Than The Pyramids
programme.sub-title: A pharaoh of the 20th dynasty, Ramses IIIs reign was marked by internal conspiracies and a tragic end that symbolised the end of the golden age of Pharaonic Egypt.
programme.desc: Djoser, Khufu, Ramses II, Ramses III, Alexander the Great and Cleopatra - this series explores the life and reign of these pharaohs while illuminating their relationship with other Pharaonic figures.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: Queens of Ancient Egypt
programme.sub-title: The Egyptian queen Tiye inspired a religious revolution over 3,000 years ago that threw Egypt into turmoil - and may have blazed a trail for the worlds leading religions.
programme.desc: The famous Cleopatra is only one in a long line of Egyptian queens spanning 3,000 years of history; we explore the lives of three of ancient Egypts fascinating and charismatic female monarchs.

programme.title: Queens of Ancient Egypt
programme.sub-title: Cleopatra II, namesake of the great Cleopatra VII, had an even more shocking reign; she saw her dynasty torn apart by hatred but also saved it from destruction.
programme.desc: The famous Cleopatra is only one in a long line of Egyptian queens spanning 3,000 years of history; we explore the lives of three of ancient Egypts fascinating and charismatic female monarchs.

programme.title: Queens of Ancient Egypt
programme.sub-title: Cleopatra Selene, daughter of Cleopatra the Great and Mark Antony, was taken to Rome as a prisoner; she eventually married the African king Juba II and became one of that continents greatest queens.
programme.desc: The famous Cleopatra is only one in a long line of Egyptian queens spanning 3,000 years of history; we explore the lives of three of ancient Egypts fascinating and charismatic female monarchs.

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: The first empress of Rome, the ruthless Livia Drusilla, carved a corpse-strewn path to putting her own son on the emperors throne before her golden dynasty descended into an age of terror.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: Livia, the first empress of Rome, came to regret the scheming that put her son Tiberius on the throne as he and his heir Caligula dragged the empire into an age of tyranny and shocking depravity.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: Claudius rose to the throne but was poisoned by his wife; after his successor Nero alienated Rome, Livia Drusillas dynasty ended with brutal power struggles but having changed the course of history.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.sub-title: Julius Caesar wanted to bring all of Gaul under his control, triggering a series of events that would bring his army to the brink of defeat - now archaeologists are uncovering what really happened.
programme.desc: Almost all evidence about the Gallic Wars came from an account written by the general himself; now historians and archaeologists are hunting for the truth about Caesars barbarian conquest.

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.sub-title: We explore the events triggered by the uniting of Gaul tribes under freedom fighter Vercingetorix, and archaeologists find evidence of the defences that the Gauls built to fight off Caesars legions.
programme.desc: Almost all evidence about the Gallic Wars came from an account written by the general himself; now historians and archaeologists are hunting for the truth about Caesars barbarian conquest.

programme.title: Out of Europe
programme.desc: For decades most experts have been convinced that Africa is the cradle of mankind, but researchers have come across more finds in recent years that cast doubt on this well-established theory.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.sub-title: The Vikings from Scandinavia establish two successful outposts along the fjords of Southern Greenland and thrive for more than four hundred years before suddenly and mysteriously disappearing.
programme.desc: Why do civilisations collapse? Follow archaeologists as they examine ruins across the world and uncover the reasons why some of historys greatest civilisations vanished.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: 1323 B.C. / B.C.E.: Egypt is still in chaos left by Akhenatens attempted religious revolution when his son, the young king Tutankhamun, dies; the 18th dynasty comes to an end in a state of disorder.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: Japans escalation of the War in the East is devastatingly effective, but despite their success it is possible to see their inevitable defeat, and they have roused the military might of the USA.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: Vatican Secret Files Exposed: The Pope and the Devil
programme.sub-title: Unpublished documents show that the Vatican tried to fight Hitler; in March 1939, Eugenio Pacelli was elected Pope. What would Pope Pius XII do - openly condemn Nazism, or remain silent... and why?
programme.desc: New and previously published documents identified and analysed by a team of experts show that the plans of Pius XII and and his closest collaborators saved over 700,000 Jews during World War II.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: 1323 B.C. / B.C.E.: Egypt is still in chaos left by Akhenatens attempted religious revolution when his son, the young king Tutankhamun, dies; the 18th dynasty comes to an end in a state of disorder.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: Countdown to Surrender
programme.sub-title: January 28th, 1945: the war reaches its climax on German soil. It is the beginning of a hundred days of horror and death, claiming more lives than in all the years of war.
programme.desc: These are the last hundred days of World War ll; we recount crucial milestones in the last days of the Third Reich and its steady decline towards the inevitable capitulation.

programme.title: Deadmans Curse: The Lost Spanish Gold
programme.sub-title: The team follows the failed route of a 1982 news team into the Valley of the Rocks, and Don and Taylor inspect possible Spanish mining artefacts.
programme.desc: A former MMA fighter, an Indigenous explorer, and a mountaineer set out into the wilderness of the Pacific Northwest to solve the 100-year-old mystery of Slumachs lost gold mine.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: What happened to Mary Magdalene after the resurrection of Jesus? We follow history enthusiasts in southern France on their quest to find the remains of the saint in a place no-one has searched before.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The Grimaldi family has held their posts as sovereigns of Monaco with the utmost grace, but one thing they have missed time and again is good luck in the love department.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Myths: Great Mysteries of Humanity
programme.sub-title: Millennia-old stone monuments - the so-called megaliths - are scattered across Europe; they come with no written sources and how and why these structures were built remains a mystery to this day.
programme.desc: Myths: how much truth lies behind them? This series takes a look at some of the speculations surrounding myths, explores outlandish theories, and puts the science behind these myths to the test.

programme.title: Genghis Khans Mongolia
programme.sub-title: The legend of the Mongols in popular imagination of being bloodthirsty marauders has been obliterated by a more nuanced reality of Mongol life where people were rewarded for talent and not status.
programme.desc: We explore the evolution of the Mongol Empire, from its humble beginnings to becoming an extraordinary force; they conquered vast territories and came to be four times larger than the Roman Empire.

programme.title: Deadmans Curse: The Lost Spanish Gold
programme.sub-title: The team follows the failed route of a 1982 news team into the Valley of the Rocks, and Don and Taylor inspect possible Spanish mining artefacts.
programme.desc: A former MMA fighter, an Indigenous explorer, and a mountaineer set out into the wilderness of the Pacific Northwest to solve the 100-year-old mystery of Slumachs lost gold mine.

programme.title: Greatest Events of World War II In Colour
programme.sub-title: Britain and France declare war when Hitler invades Poland; in May 1940, the Germans attack Holland and Belgium as a decoy. As the Wehrmacht and Luftwaffe strike in force, the French seem trapped.
programme.desc: A story of World War II told through the ten most pivotal moments in the conflict, supported by exquisitely restored and colourised footage. This is World War II as youve never seen it before.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler: Decoding A Dictator
programme.sub-title: In decoding Adolf Hitlers dictatorship, the question of why the all-powerful Fuhrer needed a close and constantly available circle at his beck and call is one deserving of examination.
programme.desc: This series explores six distinctive aspects of the life and rule of Adolf Hitler and questions how a 30-year-old uneducated nobody was able to leave a legacy of unprecedented evil.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Ramses Is eight-year-old son Seti becomes king and all eyes are on him; the young prince representes the future of the new royal family which has yet to assert its influence over the kingdom.
programme.desc: Featuring unique access to the latest archaeological discoveries, this series exposes the man behind a myth and reveals how the mighty Ramses has remained a caricature of his own propaganda.

programme.title: World War II: The Price of Empire
programme.sub-title: The Allied leaders meet for their first conference to discuss the coordination of their efforts, a Japanese Division is destroyed at sea, and the Red Army begins its advance towards Berlin.
programme.desc: The story of how a world that was centuries in the making was completely remade in years of war. Traditional powers fell from greatness as new forces rose to make the modern world.

programme.title: Vatican Secret Files Exposed: The Pope and the Devil
programme.sub-title: Hitler unleashed war and Pius XII organised meetings to thwart him, but the Allies did not trust the Popes words; meanwhile, Hitler had started sending Jews to their deaths in concentration camps.
programme.desc: New and previously published documents identified and analysed by a team of experts show that the plans of Pius XII and and his closest collaborators saved over 700,000 Jews during World War II.

programme.title: Ramses: The Great King of Egypt
programme.sub-title: Ramses Is eight-year-old son Seti becomes king and all eyes are on him; the young prince representes the future of the new royal family which has yet to assert its influence over the kingdom.

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: Nestled in the Jordanian desert, Petra is regarded as the eighth wonder of the world; scientists are still fascinated by its facades carved into the rock, its temples, and its unique hydraulic system.
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.

programme.title: Deadmans Curse: The Lost Spanish Gold
programme.sub-title: David Muise teams with Adam for a new adventure in the search for Slumachs lost gold mine.
programme.desc: A former MMA fighter, an Indigenous explorer, and a mountaineer set out into the wilderness of the Pacific Northwest to solve the 100-year-old mystery of Slumachs lost gold mine.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: We discover an intriguing new theory about Gobekli Tepe in southern Turkey; one of the worlds oldest mysteries dating back over 12,000 years, we still dont understand who built it or why.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.
